description: Dive into "Shopping Adventures in Hanoi's Malls" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Shopping Adventures in Hanoi's Malls

places.name: Aeon Mall H√† ƒê√¥ng

reviews.text: Nice, clean & tidy mall. Good amenities - clean toilets, clean & fast lifts, many benches to rest & relax. Many restaurants & kiosks. Staffs are well-trained. Excellent Japanese Standards!

The shopping mall is spacious and well-ventilated, creating a comfortable atmosphere. Food and drink stalls are fully stocked, and many shops offer frequent discounts and promotions. I managed to buy a nice pair of shoes at a great price, which made the visit even better. Overall, I'm quite satisfied with the experience. It's a family-friendly place, suitable for both adults and kids to enjoy shopping, dining, and spending time together.

One of the best shopping mall that we can go around and have good meal for the whole day. People can try all kinds of food, drink or go cinema here. But remember the gate number if you book grabs or vehicle parking.

places.address: Khu ƒê√¥ Th·ªã, H√† ƒê√¥ng, H√† N·ªôi, Vietnam

places.name: Aeon Mall Long Bien

reviews.text:
The food halls are amazing.  We chose to eat at a steak restaurant.  Very tender steak, very nice food.   The strangest thing we saw was sturgeon for sale, a live in fish tank.  It does seem a strange place.to.visit in Hanoi, but it was worth it.
There was also a talent competition going on for school kids, looked like Primary age.  They were amazing.

I recently had the chance to explore Aeon Mall Long Bi√™n, and I was thoroughly impressed! This modern shopping center is a breath of fresh air, offering a clean and comfortable environment to shop, dine, and relax.

One of the standout features for me was the impeccable cleanliness of the toilets. It's not always a given in shopping malls, but Aeon Mall Long Bi√™n definitely gets a thumbs up in this department!

Prices were also very reasonable, making it an excellent destination for those on a budget. From affordable fashion to delicious eats, there's something for everyone here.

However, I did notice one slight drawback: the ventilation on the third floor seems to be a bit off. The smell of fried meat from the restaurants wafts through the air, which can be overwhelming at times. Not a deal-breaker, but definitely something to be aware of.

All in all, I'd give Aeon Mall Long Bi√™n 4 out of 5 stars. It's a fantastic shopping destination with plenty to offer, and with a bit of tweaking to the ventilation system, it could easily become a 5-star favorite!

AEON Mall Long Bi√™n is a great shopping destination with a clean, modern layout and a good selection of quality stores. The supermarket is well-stocked with fresh produce and imported goods, making it a convenient spot for groceries. There's also a nice variety of dining options, from local Vietnamese dishes to international cuisine. Whether you're shopping, dining, or just browsing, it's a comfortable and enjoyable place to spend time.

places.generalDescription: The Savico Megamall is a multi-level shopping complex that has various retail outlets, a supermarket, food court and sufficient parking space. It features a plethora of shops spread across three floors with an extensive range of products to cater to diverse customer needs. The mall's food court serves an array of cuisines for shoppers to enjoy. Furthermore, customers have the convenience of ample parking space while shopping at Savico Megamall.

reviews.text: My go to mall for affordable and good groceries. Empty but still got good shops

The Lock&Lock store was so disappointed. This was the worst Lock&Lock store I have ever been to. The staff were lazy, talking to each other and they didn't pay any attention to the client. That's why the shop was empty. Only us there at that time. If you wanted to know the price for a product, you need to beg for it. üò°üò°üò°

Just like another shopping mall in vietnam. It is tourist friendly since several staff can speak english. You can get all you need in here, such as groceries from go's store, international restaurant like KFC, lotteria, luggage like samsonite, watch and sport apparel store, and decathlon also.

places.generalDescription: Vincom Center Ph·∫°m Ng·ªçc Th·∫°ch, located in the bustling Dong Da district, is a popular multi-level shopping destination that opened its doors in 2016. With eight floors and three underground levels, the mall is divided into sections for shopping, entertainment, dining, and beauty healthcare. It boasts a diverse range of stores including well-known brands like Guess, Ecco, Geox, Newlook, Anta, Borse Morgan and Valentino Creations.

sources.snippet: Situated in the busiest area in the Dong Da district, Vincom Center Pham Ngoc Thach has gained immense popularity since its opening in 2016. Floor DivisionSpanning eight floors and three underground floors and divided into four main sections: shopping, entertainment, food chain, and beauty healthcare, this commercial center is the favored destination for youths and families. Brand HubIt offers multiple brands like Guess, Ecco, Geox, Newlook, Anta, Borse Morgan, Valentino Creations, and many more.

reviews.text: Vincom centre is big shopping mall in Hanoi.Location is quite good and if you are looking for Branded clothing and accessories, it is a best place to get it. Prices may be higher but a good place to check out.

Vincom Center Ph·∫°m Ng·ªçc Th·∫°ch is a well-located and modern shopping mall that's perfect for a day out in Hanoi. It offers a good mix of fashion, cosmetics, and lifestyle stores, along with a variety of dining options ranging from local favorites to international chains. The mall is clean, air-conditioned, and well-organized, making it easy to explore. There's also a cinema and play area, which is great for families with kids. Staff across the shops are generally helpful and polite. Overall, it's a convenient and enjoyable place to shop, eat, and unwind in the heart of the city.

This shopping mall is quite big and have lots of brand outlets. Mall is clean. Though product offering is less. Many products are stock out.
It has movie theater and restaurants.

Washroom was clean.

places.generalDescription: Vincom Mega Mall Royal City is a bustling hub of entertainment and shopping, boasting 800 shops along with a range of leisure activities. The complex features an expansive indoor water park with a captivating rainforest theme, claimed to be the largest in Southeast Asia. Visitors can also enjoy an ice skating rink, an aquarium, and a cinema within the same vicinity.

sources.snippet: A massive underground shopping mall, Vincom Mega Mall Royal City boasts 800 retail outlets, a massive hypermarket, as well as numerous outdoor and indoor recreational facilities in Hanoi‚Äôs Thanh Xuan District. Featuring an elegant all-white interior design, the shopping mall houses an indoor ice-skating rink, cinema, and a food-and-beverage street with more than 200 international and local restaurants. Vincom Mega Mall Royal City is also home to the biggest rainforest-themed indoor water park in Southeast Asia, where visitors of all ages can enjoy six complexes of water slides, wave pools, concave sliding tubes, and water games.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Shopping Malls in Hanoi
top 5 best shopping malls in hanoi

sources.snippet: Located in the heart of Hanoi, on Minh Khai Street, Hai Ba Trung District, Time City attracts a large number of people, especially families on weekends and holidays. Unlike AeonMall, Time City includes both high-end apartments and a large commercial center, so it has a total area of ‚Äã‚Äãmore than 200,000m2. It is still a commercial center with familiar entertainment and shopping areas, but the most interesting point here is Vinpearl Aquarium Aquarium - a modern aquarium with the first tunnel in Hanoi with the scale of 4,000m2 with thousands Rare marine species.
sources.shortName: The Most Spectacular Shopping Malls In Hanoi

sources.snippet: Vincom Mega Mall Royal City is a complex of entertainment places and shopping centers, impressive with the deluxe European architecture. You will be overwhelmed by a large square with an area of nearly 30,000m2, decorated with artistic sculpture works made of white marble. In this shopping mall in Hanoi, there are many areas for you to gain the most wonderful experience such as a shopping zone with a myriad of products from furniture, electronics, shoes, clothes, cosmetics, etc. from the world‚Äôs famous brands like Zara, Converse, Lacoste, H&M, etc.
sources.shortName: Top 6 best shopping malls in Hanoi

sources.snippet: Vincom Mega Mall Royal City Thanh Xuan is a modern and luxurious shopping centre and entertainment complex on the outskirts of Hanoi. It has two subterranean floors that are home to many retail shops and also an indoor ice-skating rink, a waterpark and many restaurants.The aboveground entrance area has attractive fountains, landscaped gardens, sculptures and broad walking paths surrounded by massive apartment buildings, all in a markedly European style. The mall is located approximately 45 minutes outside the city centre.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Shopping Centers In Hanoi

sources.snippet: Vincom Mega Mall Royal City, the biggest mall in Hanoi underground, offers a diverse array of entertaining choices to fulfill all needs. Upon entering Royal City, visitors are greeted by its unique architecture, including an intricately designed entrance leading to a vast square adorned with European-style sculptures. With hundreds of stores, dining options, a 4,000-square-meter art center, and an international-standard ice skating rink, Vincom Mega Mall Royal City is definitely an all-in-one spot for entertainment.
sources.shortName: Shopping mall in Hanoi: Notable shopping destinations

sources.snippet: Officially opened in 2013, the shopping mall consists of 2 subterranean floors which are home to plenty of retail shops, many restaurants, an indoor ice rink, and a water park in a large area of 230.000 square meters. The water park is one of the favorite destinations of both local and international visitors to immerse in the cool water and explore different games. The ice rink is the first ice freezing system in Vietnam that follows the international standards with professional tools.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Amazing Shopping Malls In Hanoi

sources.snippet: Vincom Mega Mall Royal City offers many of the same options, plus much more on the entertainment spectrum. In addition to 800 shops, Royal City also features a massive rainforest-themed indoor water park (the largest in all of Southeast Asia) as well as an ice skating rink, an aquarium, and a cinema. The Vincom Mega Mall is part of the Royal City complex, designed to function as a ‚Äúminiature Western city‚Äù and absolutely earns its slogan: ‚Äúone destination ‚Äì all needs ‚Äì many options.

reviews.text: I was impressed by the mall diverse shopping options and delicious food court. A perfect destination for all ages!

Beautiful wide mall which is designed underground. It just have 2 floor, but quite wide to walk around. Upside the mall is the huge open space park with water fountain. There are relatively many restaurant and international fashion store. I visited this mall in monday and do not saw many visitors, so i felt very quiet. This mall also have ice skating and roller skate field inside.

Well, it's a good place to kill sometimes and you are welcome to bring kids to come here.

They do have some stores that have bigger spaces but don't expect the numbers of the stores here are a lot comparing with other Megamall located in other Asian countries.

Nevertheless, they do have some well-known brands.

places.name: Vincom Center Ba Trieu

reviews.text:
It's an average shopping center with many well-known international and local brands.

The first floor is dedicated to beauty - you'll find cosmetics, makeup, and skincare departments all in one place.

Fashion begins on the second floor, offering a variety of clothing stores.

The top floor features a food court with a range of typical Asian options - Chinese, Korean, sushi, and more.

A nice place to visit if you're in the area.

We are visiting Hanoi, Vietnam as a tourist from India. Super typhoon Yagi also thought it to be a fit time to visit Hanoi. All the trips were cancelled so we visited this center for some shopping. But unfortunately, most of the shops were shut here also.
We came, moved on all the floors, saw many premium brand stores. But all closed.
In normal days the experience would be much better.

Rate 7/10

This mall not so big than another one but if u just chilling and looking for some normal things u can buy. This mall good is the located, i like it because many small coffee shop nearby, feller can take one coffee here and sightseeing the people the road, feeling the atmosphere of working.

places.generalDescription: Trang Tien Plaza, situated in the heart of Hanoi overlooking Hoan Kiem Lake, is a prestigious and historic shopping destination. With over 200 renowned international brands offering fashion, accessories, cosmetics, and more, this luxurious mall showcases elegant French architectural style across its three floors. It's a favorite among Hanoi's elite for luxury shopping with top-tier brands like Cartier and Louis Vuitton on the ground floor.

sources.snippet: Located at the heart of Hanoi capital city, overlooking Hoan Kiem lake, Trang Tien plaza is the oldest and most luxurious shopping mall in Vietnam, which is home to more than 200 world-class brands of fashion, bags, cosmetics, shoes, accessories,... In addition, it is also a historical witness that has been existing along with the ups and downs of the capital. This shopping mall in Hanoi bears the mark of elegant, luxurious, delicate  French architectural style with a 20,000 display area and three floors, each of which exhibits a wide array of high-end products and items, and has different functions.
sources.shortName: Top 6 best shopping malls in Hanoi

sources.snippet: Built on the old site of the General Shopping Malls, overlooking the romantic and ancient Hoan Kiem Lake, Trang Tien Plaza has contributed to changing the face of the capital during since Renovation period. Together with the Hanoi Opera House, Hanoi Post Office, Hoan Kiem Lake, the plaza has created a beautiful architectural complex in the center Hanoi. The shopping mall has a total area of more than 20,000 square meters for business premises meeting the international standards with modern equipment and various types of products.

places.name: Trang Tien Plaza

reviews.text:
Trang Tien Plaza is a premier luxury shopping destination located in Hanoi's historic French Quarter, near Hoan Kiem Lake. Renowned for its elegant French colonial architecture and upscale ambiance, the mall offers a refined shopping experience. Ôøº Ôøº

Highlights
‚Ä¢	Luxury Brands: The plaza houses over 200 high-end international brands, including Louis Vuitton, Chanel, Dior, Cartier, and BVLGARI, catering to discerning shoppers seeking premium products.  Ôøº
‚Ä¢	Architectural Elegance: Visitors are often impressed by the mall's immaculate condition and sophisticated design, featuring a grand staircase and a spacious central atrium that are popular spots for photography.  Ôøº
‚Ä¢	Amenities: Beyond shopping, Trang Tien Plaza offers a variety of dining options, including international restaurants and cafes. The mall is also appreciated for its clean facilities, air-conditioned environment, and well-maintained restrooms, providing a comfortable retreat from Hanoi's bustling streets.  Ôøº

Visitor Insights

While Trang Tien Plaza is praised for its luxurious offerings and serene atmosphere, some visitors note that it may not be the ideal destination for budget-conscious shoppers or those seeking local crafts and souvenirs. The mall's focus on high-end brands means that prices are generally on the higher side, and the selection leans heavily towards international luxury goods.

Practical Information
‚Ä¢	Location: 24 Trang Tien Street, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi. Ôøº
‚Ä¢	Opening Hours: Monday to Thursday: 9:30 AM ‚Äì 9:30 PM; Friday to Saturday: 9:30 AM ‚Äì 10:00 PM.  Ôøº

In summary, Trang Tien Plaza offers a luxurious shopping experience in the heart of Hanoi, ideal for those interested in high-end brands and elegant surroundings. However, travelers seeking local markets or more affordable shopping options might prefer exploring other areas of the city. Ôøº

Another fancy mall I can't afford to buy anything. But the bathroom is very clean. It's cool and air conditioned throughout. Though the music is too loud for my taste because I like to contemplate all things important while I ride the porcelain throne.

I won't knock a star down for that cause some would say the music volume is optimal for covering particular sounds and noises.

A posh shopping mall which sells luxury goods and apparel from various famous brands like Cartier and Hublot etc. Great place to visit for fans or shoppers of luxury brands.

Visited in March 2025.

places.generalDescription: Lotte Center Hanoi is a multi-level shopping destination in Ba Dinh, offering a wide range of products from food to high-quality household appliances. The mall features a supermarket, department store, and even a luxurious hotel - the Reverie Saigon. This hotel boasts modern rooms, a world-class spa, dining options, an outdoor pool, fitness facilities and more. Additionally, visitors can enjoy panoramic views from the top of the building.

sources.snippet: Other than being popular for the Observation Deck, Lotte high-rise building is also a magnet for fashion-lovers. This one-stop shopping spot is home to approximately 250 fashion and lifestyle brands, which are subject to satisfy any needs or tastes. It should be noted that hypermarket is on the first floor, while imported jewelry and cosmetics are found in the second floor, women‚Äôs nicest dresses, and stylish handbags together with unisex clothes on the third floor and men‚Äôs latest fashion on the forth floor.
sources.shortName: What & Where to Buy (with Photos, Map, Tips)

sources.snippet: Being one of the best shopping malls in Hanoi Vietnam, Lotte Center, well-known as the 3rd skyscraper in Vietnam and the 2nd in Hanoi, preceded by Keangnam Hanoi, is the most high-class shopping center and entertainment place in Hanoi. Lotte has 65 floors, 267m high, outstanding with extremely unique architecture inspired by traditional Ao dai of Vietnamese women. This Hanoi mall includes a shopping area, offices, entertainment area, and convention center.
sources.shortName: Top 6 best shopping malls in Hanoi

sources.snippet: Not only one of the best malls in Hanoi, Lotte Shopping Center is also the second-highest building in this city, with 272 meters tall and an area of 247,000 meters square. With the first six floors, you can catch sight of up to 250 high-end brands, ranging from cosmetics to home appliances. Besides that, the Lotte shopping center also covers the Lotte Mart, modern offices, a 5-star hotel, a spa, a rooftop bar, and so forth.

reviews.text: I like the cosy, not too spacious area like this Lotte in Lieu Giai. Clean, less crowded, all big brands & eateries, play time here. Lotte mart is big enough for shopping. My fav place to go.

Lotte Center Hanoi is a modern skyscraper featuring an impressive observation deck with panoramic views of Hanoi's skyline. The mall offers a wide range of international brands, restaurants, and a rooftop bar. It's a perfect place to shop, dine, and enjoy breathtaking cityscapes in a clean and comfortable environment.

Lotte Center Hanoi is a great place to cool down and do some shopping. You can find clothes and shoes from brands like Vans, Converse, and Uniqlo. There's also a supermarket on the ground floor with plenty of tasty snacks and treats - and prices are noticeably better than at Lotte in Korea. Definitely worth checking out if you're in the area.

Since its opening in late 2013, it has become a popular spot for leisure and entertainment in Hanoi. Situated at a strategic location just under 4km from Hoan Kiem Lake, it boasts modern infrastructure spread across approximately 230,000m2 with 11 entrances.

places.name: Vincom Mega Mall Times City

reviews.text: This clean place boasters with lots of services and utilities. In addition, the proximity to other main hubs is top.

Just like a normal vincom mall in Vietnam. Have a plenty of restaurant, cafe, international and national fashion store, supermarket, pharmacies, and aquarium called Vinpearl. This mall have just one underground floor. Also have roller skating arena. The terms of "mega mall" is not suitable for this mall, for me, the size is just "normal mall"

Vincom Mega Mall Times City is one of the most impressive and modern shopping centers in Hanoi. It offers a great mix of shopping, dining, and entertainment options, making it a perfect destination for families, couples, and tourists alike.

The mall is spacious and well-maintained, with a wide range of international and local brands. Whether you're looking for fashion, electronics, cosmetics, or home goods, you'll likely find what you need here. The layout is easy to navigate, and the atmosphere is bright and welcoming.

One of the highlights is the Times City Aquarium (Vinpearl Aquarium), which is a fantastic experience for both kids and adults. There's also a large indoor play area and cinema, making it a great spot for a full day out.

The dining options are diverse, ranging from Vietnamese cuisine to international fast food and cafes. There's something to suit every taste and budget.

Overall, Vincom Mega Mall Times City combines convenience, entertainment, and shopping all under one roof. It's definitely one of the top malls in Hanoi.

places.generalDescription: Nestled on Nha Chung Street near St Joseph's Cathedral, Collective Memory - The House of Curios is a charming gift shop showcasing contemporary Vietnamese art and handcrafted goods. This boutique offers a curated selection of unique souvenirs and crafts created by Hanoi-based artists and designers. From limited edition art prints to ethnic coffee beans from Da Lat, the store features an array of modern mementos that reflect Hanoi's vibrant culture.

sources.snippet: This trendy Hanoi shop founded by a travel writer and travel photographer brings together a carefully curated collection of hand-made Vietnamese products and brands. For some of the most eye-catching designs that will make a statement when you return home, this is a place to find something original.
sources.shortName: 10 unmissable shopping spots in Hanoi

places.name: Collective Memory - The House of Curios

reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful shop. Visited this place two years ago and had my eye on a beautiful poster but didn't get it then. Bought it this time and I couldn't be happier with the purchase. Located just a stone's throw away from the cathedral. Highly recommend. Owner speaks English and is very warm.

Great little shop that's different to the rest on this great shopping street.

The candles are amazing - just come for these and then check out the rest of the quirky and cool things they have. A true artisan boutique shop. Wishes we could have got the large candles but weight always an issue when flying. If only we could get these back in London.

I love Collective Memory, which the owner Nga (pardon me if I got the spelling wrong) described as an invisible person. It is an interesting space to browse in and I loved the quirky interpretations and representations of things Vietnamese.

Bought quite a lot of prints, cards and bamboo trays there. I have hung 3 of the prints up in a new kitchen already (though I need to reposition them a little). Would recommend a visit if you are looking for meaningful and memorable souvenirs from Hanoi.

It is really close to the Cathedral and the surrounding area is interesting to wander around in too.

The store offers a wide variety of products at affordable prices, and it's clearly popular with the locals. However, I noticed a significant number of cockroaches crawling on the snack shelves, which was quite unsettling.

places.generalDescription: Vincom Center Metropolis, situated within the Royal City complex, is a multifaceted destination offering contemporary art at the Vincom Center for Contemporary Art (VCCA) and a modern shopping experience at Vincom Centre Ba Trieu. VCCA showcases installation and media-based artworks, with recent exhibitions featuring Filipino artist Cian Dayrit's captivating pieces.
places.name: Vincom Center Metropolis

reviews.text: Vincom Center Metropolis in Hanoi is a great place to shop, eat, and relax. It has a mix of international and local brands, including luxury stores like Louis Vuitton and Gucci. You'll also find plenty of restaurants, from casual spots to fine dining, plus a modern cinema for entertainment. The mall is family-friendly with play areas for kids. It offers great amenities like free Wi-Fi, plenty of parking, and helpful staff. While it can get crowded on weekends, it's still a top choice for both locals and tourists looking for a fun and convenient shopping experience.

Vincom is one of the best shopping malls in Hanoi, offering a wide range of stores, restaurants, and entertainment options. It's a great place to spend a few hours whether you're looking to shop, dine, or simply relax. The mall is spacious and well-designed, with multiple floors dedicated to different categories, from high-end brands to affordable stores, catering to all types of shoppers.

What I really appreciate about Vincom is the variety of dining options. Whether you're in the mood for a quick bite or a sit-down meal, there are plenty of choices available, from local food stalls to international chains. The food court is particularly convenient for a quick meal while shopping, and the quality of food is generally good.

The mall is also home to a cinema, making it a great destination for a day out. There's a vibrant atmosphere, and it's always buzzing with people, especially on weekends. However, it can get quite crowded during peak hours, which sometimes makes the shopping experience a bit less enjoyable.

Overall, Vincom is a reliable shopping center with everything you need under one roof. It's not overly luxurious, but it's modern, convenient, and definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.

As a tourist that likes buying goods to take back home, it's a great shopping complex with stores over 4 levels. Not insanely big but easy to move around, great food options and a giant winmart.
Brand name stores such as pandora, adudas, muji (across 2 levels), Uniqlo, aldo, clavin Klein, crocs, pharmacies, sunglasses, perfumes, home and kitchenware store and my fave..a giant winmart (more on that as a separate review).
Also has restaurants with dine in areas (chinese, a few Japanese options, buffet hot pot, pizza, Som Thai), photobooth, kids activities/games and a Starbucks, Highlands coffee and a french boulangerie.
Nearby to the Lotte shopping complex with the observation deck (no idea how to walk there though) if you want to combine the 2 and a grab car can be booked from the old quarter for aprox 50-60vd.

This shopping and entertainment haven has quickly become a must-visit destination in Hanoi, showcasing a unique blend of luxury and modern architecture. As the fifth Vincom trade center in the city, it stands out with its stunning design featuring soft glass blocks and elegant natural stone patterns reminiscent of Indian royal structures.

sources.snippet: Vincom Nguyen Chi Thanh is located in the center of the Cau Giay District, Dong Da District, near two major universities: Foreign Trade University and Diplomatic Academy. This is a romantic dating area that is frequently visited by university students.

To be fair two floors are full, one is full of food outlets and the other has a very well stocked Khonan and a very quiet Winmart.
Just B1 floor is alive. There are winmart, some restaurant, and famous topokki buffet Dokki. Then the rest floor is all empty. Regret to go here.
